blocks.text: **DNS (Domain Name System)** is a system that **translates human-readable domain names** (like www.google.com) into IP addresses (like 142.250.182.206) that computers use to identify each other on the internet.
It acts like the **internet‚Äôs phonebook**, allowing users to access websites easily without remembering complex numerical addresses.

numberedList.title: Easy to remember website names
points: Computers use IP addresses (like 142.250.182.206), which are hard for humans to remember.
DNS lets us use simple names like google.com instead.

numberedList.title: Faster access to websites
points: DNS quickly converts domain names into IP addresses so your browser can connect to the correct website.

numberedList.title: Organized Internet system
points: The internet has billions of websites. DNS keeps them organized and helps route requests efficiently.

numberedList.title: Supports multiple services
points: DNS is not just for websites; it also directs emails, subdomains, and other services.

numberedList.title: Reduces errors
points: Without DNS, users would have to type IP addresses manually, which could easily cause mistakes.

numberedList.title: Scalable and reliable
points: DNS servers are spread worldwide, so even if one server fails, others can handle the requests.

blocks.text: DNS is like a **school contact book** ‚Äì you look up a friend‚Äôs name, not their phone number, and the book tells you the number. Without DNS, the internet would be just a huge list of numbers! üìíüåê

numberedList.title: Opening a website
points: When you type **www.google.com** in your browser, DNS translates it to its IP address, like **142.250.182.206**, so your browser can load the site.

numberedList.title: Sending an email
points: When you send an email to **pari@example.com**, DNS finds the mail server of **example.com** using **MX records** and delivers your email.

numberedList.title: Visiting a subdomain
points: Typing **blog.parisdream90.com** uses DNS to find the server hosting the blog, even though the main website may be hosted somewhere else.

numberedList.title: Using online games or apps
points: Apps like **Fortnite, WhatsApp, or Instagram** use DNS to connect to their servers automatically without you knowing the IP addresses.

numberedList.title: Video streaming
points: Platforms like **YouTube or Netflix** use DNS to direct your request to the nearest server, making streaming faster.

blocks.text: DNS records are like instructions that tell the internet how to handle your domain name. Here are the main types:

numberedList.title: A Record (Address Record)
points: **Purpose:** Connects a domain name to an **IPv4 address** (the website‚Äôs number).
**Example:** example.com ‚Üí 192.168.1.1
**Use:** It allows your browser to know where the website is hosted.

numberedList.title: AAAA Record (IPv6 Address Record)
points: **Purpose:** Same as A record but for **IPv6 addresses** (longer numbers used for the modern internet).
**Use:** Needed for websites using IPv6 instead of IPv4.

numberedList.title: CNAME Record (Canonical Name Record)
points: **Purpose:** Points one domain name to another **domain name** instead of an IP address.
**Example:** www.example.com ‚Üí example.com
**Use:** Useful if you have multiple subdomains and want them all to point to the same site.

numberedList.title: MX Record (Mail Exchange Record)
points: **Purpose:** Directs emails to the **mail server** of your domain.
**Example:** Emails sent to user@example.com go to the mail server mail.example.com.
**Use:** Necessary for sending and receiving emails for your domain.

numberedList.title: NS Record (Name Server Record)
points: **Purpose:** Tells the internet which **DNS server is authoritative** for your domain.
**Example:** example.com ‚Üí ns1.hosting.com
**Use:** Ensures queries for your domain go to the correct DNS server.

numberedList.title: PTR Record (Pointer Record)
points: **Purpose:** Reverse of A record; maps an **IP address back to a domain name**.
**Example:** 192.168.1.1 ‚Üí example.com
**Use:** Often used for verifying email servers (**anti-spam**).

numberedList.title: TXT Record (Text Record)
points: **Purpose:** Stores **text information** in the DNS.
**Example:** Used for email verification like **SPF or DKIM**.
**Use:** Helps prevent spam and prove ownership of a domain.

numberedList.title: SRV Record (Service Record)
points: **Purpose:** Specifies the location of **services** like VoIP or chat servers.
**Example:** _sip._tcp.example.com ‚Üí 10 5 5060 sipserver.example.com
**Use:** Useful for apps and services needing specific server information.

numberedList.title: SOA Record (Start of Authority Record)
points: **Purpose:** Contains information about the domain and its **DNS zone**.
**Example Info:** Primary server, admin email, refresh rate, etc.
**Use:** Essential for DNS servers to manage the domain properly.

**Easy to remember** ‚Äì You can type website names like google.com instead of hard-to-remember numbers (IP addresses).
**Faster access** ‚Äì DNS quickly converts names to IP addresses, so websites open faster.
**Scalable** ‚Äì It can handle billions of website addresses all over the world.
**Load distribution** ‚Äì DNS can share traffic among multiple servers to avoid website overload.
**Reliable** ‚Äì With many DNS servers worldwide, the system is decentralized and doesn‚Äôt depend on one server.
**Supports multiple services** ‚Äì Not just websites; DNS also helps with emails, subdomains, and other internet services.
**Server failure** ‚Äì If a DNS server stops working, the websites linked to it may not open.
**Security risks** ‚Äì Hackers can perform attacks like DNS spoofing, redirecting users to fake sites.
**Propagation delay** ‚Äì Changes in website IP or creation of a new site may take time to update worldwide.
**Complex management** ‚Äì Managing DNS for large organizations can be complicated and error-prone.
**Privacy concerns** ‚Äì DNS queries can show which websites a user visits, risking privacy.
**High dependency** ‚Äì The internet heavily depends on DNS; if DNS faces issues, many websites and services are affected.
